intro: Lithospermum cobrense, commonly known as the Cobrense rock pepper, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, violet to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its roots contain alkaloids, which have been studied for potential medicinal properties. Lithospermum cobrense is also valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens due to its striking floral display.
